abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Telecommunications Project in Togo. The
            primary objectives of the project were to: (a) support a
            program of institutional and management improvement in the
            telecommunications sector; (b) improve the quality of
            service to existing subscribers and extend the provision of
            services to meet current and projected demand in the two
            main economic regions; and (c) improve Office des Postes et
            Telecommunications du Togo (OPTT) financial performance,
            with a view to increasing the flow of finds to the Borrower.
            Bank's performance was highly satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (i) the government will
            need to continue and extend, with the participation of all
            stakeholders, the process of sector reform which it has
            recently commenced with a view to opening up participation
            in the sector to new service providers and creating
            opportunities which are attractive for private investors;
            (ii) the unstable political and civil situation in the
            country during 1991 to 1993, the absence of a commercial
            arms-length relationship between OPTT and the Government and
            the failure to implement some of the key institutional
            development components all contributed to the difficulties
            faced by OPTT; (iii) the project benefitted from new
            technologies and falling costs during the implementation
            period; and (iv) those areas of the project which were
            successfully implemented were facilitated by the continuity
            and good working relationships between staff in both OPTT
            and International Development Association (IDA) during the
            implementation period.
